Subject: An OK Book, but not TOO OK
Body: Roy Eberhardt is a kid who moves from Montana to Florida, and doesn't like it at all. He expects what he gets though; a bully: Dana Matherson. Roy wouldn't have met Napolean at all if it weren't for Dana, though. After Dana mashed his face into his school bus window, Roy saw the boy.

Subject: No good adult role models, among other things
Body: The recommendation of 10 years old and up seems a little young to me, honestly. Out of the three main families discussed, domestic violence is definitely going on in one of them and hinted at in another. The fact that it’s not even addressed, simply a detail in the story is troubling.
